oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Chet Atkins Interviewed by Bob Allen Side One
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Chet Atkins. The recording takes place on 10-31-78.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:24) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins how much time he spends in his office as of late. (0:51) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins what his daily schedule is like. (2:05) -- Chet Atkins describes his home studio. (2:17) -- Bob Allen asks about what it's like for Chet to appear in public at restaurants or clubs. (4:44) -- Chet Atkins describes his typical day and morning routine. (6:50) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins how many hours a day he practices. Chet Atkins describes that he most often practices material and tunes from upcoming shows. (9:18) -- Chet Atkins describes that he listens to other instruments more than guitar players. Chet Atkins explains that guitar is a limited instrument compared to piano. (10:42) -- Bob Allen asks Chet what music he most often listens to. "I like to hear people improvise…subsitution chords/ideas…Bill Evans type piano player." (12:55) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins how many shows he plays each year. (15:41) -- Bob Allen mentions that Larrie Londin thanks Chet Atkins and Jerry Reed for giving him work. "For me, he's my favorite drummer." - Chet Atkins. (17:06) -- Bob Allen asks about Chet Atkins traveling on tour. Chet goes on to describe his distaste with flying. (20:21) -- Bob Allen asks about Chet's personal outside habits. Chet Atkins mentions his love for golf. (21:18) -- Tape cuts to Bob Allen and Chet Atkins at a benefit. (23:07) -- Chet Atkins mentions his distaste for train rides. (24:30) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins about his mail. (26:50) -- Bob Allen asks about Chet Atkins' transition between recording and being an A&R man. (27:55) -- Chet Atkins speaks about Steve Sholes. (29:22) -- Chet Atkins speaks about Owen Bradley. Owen Bradley was an assistant to Paul Cohen for years. Chet mentions that he was working as an A&R man before Owen. (31:41) -- Chet Atkins describes Owen Bradley starting a film studio for commercials. Owen ended up recording more than he worked with film. (33:08) -- Chet Atkins mentions the RCA 1525 McGavock studio with a curved roof. (33:49) -- Chet Atkins mentions recording on homemade tape machines running at 30 ips. (34:24) -- Chet describes Jim Reeves' desire to have a closer sound. (35:37) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins how producing has changed over the years. Chet mentions that Steve Sholes was the first one to put "produced by" on a record. (36:48) -- Chet Atkins discusses how Steve Sholes influenced him. (38:00) -- Bob Allen asks about the costs of running a session in 1978. (41:12) -- Chet Atkins discusses how Nashville has changed since he arrived.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Atkins, Chet;
